message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL 

The paper deals with the problem of visual localization, which is a fundamental problem in computer vision. The paper proposes a novel approach based on a joint geometric and semantic understanding of the world, which is likely to fall under the category of computer vision (cs.CV). The paper also mentions the relevance of the proposed approach in the context of autonomous robots, which suggests that it could also belong to the category of robotics (cs.RO). The paper proposes a generative model for descriptor learning, which involves training on semantic scene completion as an auxiliary task, indicating that it could also belong to the category of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper mentions experiments on several challenging large-scale localization datasets, which suggests that it could also belong to the category of natural language processing (cs.CL) as it involves dealing with semantic information.
